figure_1: (Q12) Self-reported confidence to evaluate a research paper for the appropriateness of the study design used, the statistical methods used, and the author’s statistical interpretation of results, by role (direct vs. indirect) (Data supporting this figure are shown in Table 5 in Additional file 3)
figure_4: (Q18) Comparison of frequencies (%) of respondents reporting all of four defining KT barriers between those who selected for keeping current full text individual primary research papers (IPRP) versus those who did not. Defining KT barriers include 1) an hour or less available per week to keeping up, 2) low confidence to assess statistical methods used in a study, 3) inability to explain confounding bias, and 4) does not usually read methods section) (data supporting this figure are shown in Table 11A in Additional file 3)
